original_title: Sri Lanka expects US$900mn from rubber, US$700mn from coconut exports
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sr Lanka is expecting to earn 900 million US dollars from rubber related exports in 2023 and 700 million from coconut exports, Plantations Industries Minister Ramesh Pathirana said.
Sri Lanka is also expecting to export around 290 million US dollars of tea in 2023, Minister Pathirana was quoted as saying in a statement by the President’s media office.
Sri Lankan firms have built markets abroad for coconut milk and activated carbon.

President Ranil Wickremesinghe was expecting to build a ‘coconut triangle’ involving Jaffna, Mannar and Mulltaitivu districts to expand cultivation as exports are expected to grow to 2.0 billion dollars over the next decade, he said.

Sri Lanka is also expecting to earn around 1.2 billion US dollars from tea this year. The country was also hoping to export tea to Iran worth 500 million dollars in return for oil. (Colombo/Aug03/.2023)
